data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Your right foot takes 9 steps on the up side, then 8 steps on the left side, then 2 steps on the right side. You cannot be in both directions. In order to return to your starting point, you must go back in the direction you came from. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and turn right then take 4 steps, take 4 steps, turn around and turn right. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The only way to return to the starting point is to return to the beginning. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 7 steps backwards if you return to start from point A. Take 7 steps backwards if you return to start from point B. Take 5 steps backwards if you return to start from point C. We know that the starting point is A. Take one step backwards if you return to start from point C. We know that the starting point is A. Turn left if you take 5 steps backwards if you turn left. And these are the steps you should turn to return to start. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around then back, repeating steps 1-10. Repeating steps 1-10. Turn around for 5 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Suppose you can return to any point in order: Left Turn Left Turn Turn on a map. If you go directly to the right (right) you have to turn around. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

After taking 8 steps (turning right), you proceed to take 8 steps (turn right) and finally 9 steps (turn right). If you turn right (right), the number of steps (turn right) is 9 and the number of steps (take out) is 8 (turn right). So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around needs an additional 8 steps. So in total 8 steps. Take 2 steps. So in total 2 steps. So in an eight-step round trip, you need 4 squares. So the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
As always facing forward, you can return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around and taking 2 steps have the same outcome. If you turn around and take 3 steps, you take 3 steps back. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When facing forward, take 1 step forward and then the opposite direction again. When facing backwards, one must take 1 step backward. If you take 1 step backward, you do not take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is always facing forward. Therefore, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first step is backward because you have taken 1 step left. If you follow the instructions and end up facing forward again, you’ll take 9 steps left. The second step in the same direction is forward because you’ve take 1 step left. The third step in the same direction is forward because you’ve take 9 steps left. So the answer is No.

You are always facing forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward you are one step ahead of your starting point instead of facing backward. So, the answer is yes.

Turn around. Make an I in every direction. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. So, the answer is No.

Taking 11 steps back causes you to return to the starting point. Taking 9 steps back causes you to finish. So, the answer is Yes.

Just like taking 7 steps, you can turn around and turn right. So, the answer is No.

A person can turn around and then turn around and then turn around and take 9 steps and then turn around. You could then take the last sequence in the first two sections and turn left. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person can not turn back and forth in eight steps. The first step is turning right. The second step is turning right. The third step on the series is turning left. So, the answer is No.

You first go one step, then three steps, then six steps. So, the answer is no.

Doing any of these moves will not return you to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow the instructions, you turn around and take 3 steps. If you follow the instructions, you take 7 steps. If you take 10 steps, you return to the starting point at 3 steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.

The first step is always towards forward. The second step is always backward. The third step is always forward. The last step is always backward. So, the answer is no.

People usually always face forward regardless of how much they are pushed backward. 9 steps left is a 'leftward' step, where 7 steps is the first step backward. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You could walk back 4 times if you 'd just stopped at one point. So, the answer is yes.

Let' s say the starting point is a square. When facing forward and taking 6 steps left you will be facing the beginning of the square. When facing forward and taking 6 steps right you will be facing the setting of the square. So, the answer is yes.

Turn right, take 5 steps, take 5 steps to go around, turn around is repeated. So, the answer is Yes.

Take one step forward, then one step backward. Always face forward. Take 3 steps backward, then three steps forward. Take 2 steps backward, then one step forward. Take 3 steps backward, then three steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Taking 1 step is the same as taking 3 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

Turning around involves taking 9 steps. Turning around involves taking 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

In order to return to your starting point, one should always face forward and always take 4 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

This is the order of steps that one takes to get to the starting point from the beginning. If one takes 7 steps to get to the starting point then the first step would be to take 7 steps. In the first step, the opposite direction of what is happening is taken. The second step, where you take 2 steps, is to take 2 steps. The third step, where you take 3 steps, is to take 3 steps. So, the answer is No.

Take 8 steps backward because your body is still facing forward. 4 steps backward doesn't go back. 4 steps backward is more of a challenge than any of the other steps. Take 3 steps left than the original number of steps or you get to your starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you ever face forward and face backward you cannot turn around and get back to the starting point. If you always face forward and face sideways you take 6 steps forward and turn around and get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Turn around means you walk to a certain point in the distance. That point can be the starting point. Turn right means you turn around and turn around. So, the answer is No.

Just because you started with 4 steps left does not mean that you are facing forward. Five steps backward is the exact opposite of moving forward. So, the answer is no.

Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you are moving straight forward. When you take 8 steps backward, you’re moving straight backward. If you take 8 steps backward, you’re moving backward. When you take 1 step forward, you are moving forward. When you take 7 steps backward, you are moving backward. When you take 7 steps right, you are moving right. When you take 1 step left, you are moving left. When you take 1 step right, you are moving right. So, the answer is No.

You always face forward when you walk. There are 4 steps forward and then 4 steps backward, meaning you need to go progressively toward the right. So, the answer is Yes.
